title: Clean install is not prompting user to install Orbot or give information about that feature
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
OA version 0.0.18

Phone
Moto G first generation running Android 5.1.1

title: Error uploading image not detected
body:
Here's the feedback that you asked for in the OTF-active mailing list.

## Description

I was testing the application (my first use of the application and archive.org). I was trying to upload an image, but I'm in a train, so the internet connection is not really stable and the upload failed. The app did not detect that and kept showing "Uploading image"

Edit: I'm using the 0.0.18-alpha-1 version: https://github.com/OpenArchive/openarchive-android/releases/download/0.0.18-alpha-1/OpenArchive-0.0.18-alpha-1-releaseflavor-release.apk

## Steps to reproduce

1. Make a photo
1. Upload the image with the OA Android app
2. Disconnect your internet

## Expected behaviour

The app shows a message saying "upload failed" and preferably also a retry-button.

## Actual behaviour

App keeps saying "Uploading image". To retry you have to click back, click your image again and click upload again.

## Screenshot

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/832723/45418302-733b3b00-b684-11e8-88b2-e0d47b868b19.png)

title: Thumbnails, media disappear when Google Photos remove
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: When you clean/remove data using Google Photos, the thumbnail and photos disappear from OpenArchive. We need to cache a copy of the thumbnail in the OA app, and possibly the media as well.

title: app crashes when trying to share a photo with nearby
body:
Trying to share a photo using nearby feature either causes the app to stop (Case 1) or nothing seems to happen (seems broken) -Case 2

**Case 1**
I'm connected to wifi.
open my OpenArchive. 
Tap on a photo I want to share.
Tap on the nearby icon.
Get an error message saying 'OpenArchive has Stopped'.
Tap 'Close app'.
Relaunch. 
Try again. Same steps. App stops!

Device: Moto G play
OS: Android 6.0.1
App version: 0.0.17 RC 1

**Case 2**
I'm connected to wifi.
Open my OpenArchive.
Tap on a photo I want to share. 
Tap the nearby icon.
App wants to make my tablet visable on bluetooth-tap allow.
searching for devices.
Device found. Tap on the device to connect.
On the tablet, processing circle never moves past 0%. 
Another device (motoG) never detects the device (tablet). 
File never shared. The screen remains on Nearby screen.

Device: Nexus 7
OS: Android 5.1.1
App version: 0.0.17 RC 1

title: CRASH OCCUR WHEN ATTEMPTING TO OPEN AN MP3 OT MP4 FILE WITHIN OPRNARCHIVE
label: [Label(name="PLEASE TEST"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
#### Actual behavior

Openarchive crashes and quits the upload page when attempting to open .mp3 or .mp4 extension files which were imported from sdcard.

#### How to reproduce
* Launch OpenArchive.

* Click on the floating action button, to reveal the import media icon.

* Click the import media icon and import mp4 and mp3extension files from your sdcard.

* After importing, click on any of the files from the home page to access it.

* Then click on the thumbnail within the upload page.

The app should crash and quit the upload page.

#### TESTING ENVIRONMENT

* Browser/App version: v0.0.17 beta 5

* Operating system: Android v6.0 marshmallow

* Device: Itel p12

title: Toggle Bluetooth  option off and on within the app setting and the receive nearby option becomes inactive.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
#### Actual behavior

Clicking the receive nearby icon does nothing, after the bluetooth option under the app settings had been toggled off and on.

#### How to reproduce

1. Launch Openarchive

2. Click on the floating action button to reveal the receive nearby icon.

3. Click on the icon to observe its behavior.
(It will prompt you to switch bluetooth on and then it will begin a search for nearby hosts)

4. Press the back key on your device to dismiss the activity 

5.  Access the settings page, from the three dot menu located at the top right corner of the homepage.

6. Locate the bluetooth option toggle and turn it Off and then On again

7. Press the back button once to arrive at the home page and repeat steps 2 and 3.

* OpenArchive version: V0.0.17 beta 5

* Operating system:  Android v6.0 marshmallow

     * Chipset: Spread

* Device: Itel p12

title: Size of app?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body: It is now 5.7MB, just want to check in about size.

title: Floating buttons are inactive in the latest release.
body:
Only one out of the five floating action button works, the rest are inactive in the latest release.

### How to reproduce.

* Launch the app and grant the necessary permissions.
(Even after granting, check the app's info to confirm that permissions have been granted, in my case I noticed and had to grant them manually)

* Complete the slides to arrive at the homepage.

* While on the homepage, locate a big , blue, floating (+) action button at the bottom right corner.

* Click on this big button to reveal other labelled sub-action buttons.

* The issue tend to exist with the second button from below and the rest upward.
While the first button from below work as expected.

* Now click on the sub-action buttons to test their functions.

App version: V0.0.17 beta 4

Operating system: Android v6.0 marshmallow

title: EventBus causing LibNearby to Crash
body:
## Issue
Eventbus isn't registered properly, perhaps should be registered during an activity lifecycle event.  

## Reproduce by
1. Click floating action button (represented by a "plus" sign).
2. Click "Nearby Receive" button
3. Click "cancel" on bottom right of screen, or "paired devices only". 

This will try to unregister EventBus which may have not been registered if bluetooth isn't turned on. 
If EventBus is registered even on the constructor of _BluetoothReceiver_ this will still fail.

## Fix 
Register Eventbus in an Activity.
Or substitute Libnearby library with a similar library.

## Error 
```
Process: net.opendasharchive.openarchive.release, PID: 22535  java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Failed resolution of: Lde/greenrobot/event/EventBus; at info.guardianproject.nearby.bluetooth.BluetoothReceiver.start(BluetoothReceiver.java:67)
     at net.opendasharchive.openarchive.nearby.NearbyActivity.startClient(NearbyActivity.java:359)
 at net.opendasharchive.openarchive.nearby.NearbyActivity.onCreate(NearbyActivity.java:161)
```

title: some 1-star ratings in Google Play are actually positive
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
They are in Arabic and Persian, could it be a Right to Left discrepancy? Would love thoughts, not too concerned about it, but could see it scaling to be a larger problem when we get more reviews.

Some mysteries: 
- A few 1-star ratings were negative and the 5-star ones I translated were positive, so I'm really unsure what's going on since it would follow that 5 stars would = dissatisfied if my theory were correct.

- Examples of ratings that didn't correspond to the stars (according to g-translate):

A.M. gave 1 star and wrote: Very good and very good
anon. user gave 3 stars and wrote: Excellent
Q.N.  gave 3 stars and wrote: Great

title: Add to F-Droid
label: [Label(name="PLEASE TEST"), Label(name="adminstrative")]
body: It would be great to have this on the https://f-droid.org/ catalog

title: Add Bluetooth Nearby sharing and new Onboard UI
body:
This update includes a big new feature (nearby sharing over bluetooth), a simple new onboarding flow to highlight main features, and a bit of a code re-org and update.

The main difference is that users are no longer required to sign up for the Internet Archive to use the app. They are only prompted to sign in / sign up once they want to upload to IA. They can use the app for nearby sharing, media capture, etc w/o even using IA at all.

title: add nearby "wind" sharing over BT / Wifi
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Any file you have added into OA should be possible to easily share with other devices around you via Bluetooth or Wifi. Build upon other Guardian Project work on nearby network "wind" sharing to do this.

Also support easy sharing of OA app itself.

title: Download .torrent from and make it easy to share
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: IA generates a .torrent of our uploaded files. We should be able to easily share that with people directly for download using mobile / desktop torrent clients. This is especially true for video downloading in places where bandwidth is sketchy or limited.

title: Integrate display of media file hash from IA
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: IA provides md5 / sha1 hashes after publish. We should grab those, compare locally, and store for future display. Also sha256.

title: About Page language update/refinement
body:
OpenArchive is a free, open-source mobile application dedicated to maintaining the privacy, provenance, and preservation of your media. It enables you to add metadata and Creative Commons licensing to your audiovisual media and then send it to the Internet Archive over Tor. Thus offering more agency over your media, while protecting civil liberties and increasing interoperability for those who want to find and reuse/remix it in the future.

OpenArchive is developed in partnership with the Internet Archive, StoryMaker, Scal.io, and Guardian Project, with generous support from the Knight Foundation, and founded by Natalie Cadranel.

title: IA Sign In time-out issue - intermittant

Screen goes white when I try to log in, then I get the following error:

"webpage not available" the "webpage at link could not be loaded because net::ERR_TIMED_OUT

When I can log in, it seemed to lag a bit, perhaps about 15 seconds

title: Access to more metadata fields?
body:
from WITNESS:

> 2) On the other hand, if people want to add more metadata, is there a way
> for people to select from the available Internet Archive elements other
> than the ones I see in Nathan's collection? I'm thinking, for example, that
> it might be valuable for some folks to be able to add more descriptive or
> rights/contact info (See for example
> https://archive.org/details/WITNESS_002 this upload from WITNESS). Or
> would the user just do this off-app later?

We are trying to balance the experience between the users who will likely just fill out nothing and leave all the defaults, and the ones who would want access to all the possible fields that IA offers.

Right now, you can login to IA later and edit to your hearts content. In the future, I think the ability to expand or customize the list of fields on the client app, and edit the upload later would be great to add.

title: warn user about risks of embedded metadata
body:
> 1) Given that their original media will be available, will users be aware
> of what metadata they are embedding in their video before they upload it?

At this point, there is no analysis of the media they are importing. I think we could perhaps have a popup to let them know about apps like ObscuraCam or just a gentle reminder about metadata, privacy, and the like.

title: CC licensing options ideas

title: Remove "Share Link" and keep "Share Media"
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: This would depend on how easy it is to remove the media once sharing. Seems so on the platforms I've shared on, so that one could just send the link if they really wanted by deleting the media. I am sure this option is there to take file size / bandwith into consideration, but it'd be great if we had only one option for folks vs. two, if possible!

title: Difficult to get back to app when sharing outside app
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: This may be an android-specific issue and unsolvable, but it'd be great if it were possible to get back into the OA app. without having to hit the "back" arrow multiple times after media shared via other apps (twitter/fb, etc.). It's not very intuitive, would be great to have some way to get straight back to the OA app.

title: Social sign-in option
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: For those not as concerned about anonymity, it'd be great if we could include auto-login from twitter/fb/google - lower priority

title: "sign in" screen for IA clarification
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Make it more explicit that media is being sent to IA -- perhaps just put the logo next to sign in or just log in to the internet archive (or IA if too long)?

title: Add smart "share" menu
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Once media is published to IA, then the media display page should show the "SHARE" menu, with the sub-options for "Share Link..." and "Share Media...".

"Share Link..." would do what it does now, share a plain text snippet with the media title and link, good for posting to twitter, whatsapp, facebook, etc, as a link

"Share Media..." would share the original media file along with the text snippet including the IA archive.org link, license information,etc, so that you can upload to another site like YouTube, Facebook, etc, but include the original source description in the upload description.

title: Last edit for "About" page grammar
body:
The last paragraph should read:

OpenArchive was developed in partnership with the Internet Archive, StoryMaker, and Scal.io with generous support from the Knight Foundation.

title: Content for "About" page edits
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
## Needs to be more concise and grammatically correct, can you update it to:

OpenArchive is a free, open-source mobile application dedicated to maintaining the privacy, provenance, and preservation of your media. You can add metadata and Creative Commons licensing to your audiovisual media and then send it to the Internet Archive via Tor. It offers more agency over your media, while protecting civil liberties and increasing interoperability for those interested in finding it and reusing it in the future.
## OpenArchive was developed in partnership with the Internet Archive, StoryMaker, and Scal.io with generous support from the Knight Foundation.

Of course please keep all the links!

title: Three fonts on the initial homescreen
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: I can't get back to it now that I've been playing with the app, but if you look at the fonts on the homepage when you first log in, you'll notice they're all different, as well as different sizes.

title: Homescreen? latest image persists when closing/opening the app
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: I thought it would take me to the home screen when I closed and then re-opened the app, but it just shows the list of uploads we've done, which seems a bit confusing. Is there a way to have them save somewhere and have a homescreen, or do you not think a homescreen is necessary?

title: Image for background or on top next to name while in-app?
label: [Label(name="UX"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It'd be great to have the IA logo (Brewster OK'd co-branding) or something relevant for the background.

If we can't figure out anything, I'm partial to NASA's photo of Sagan's Voyager Golden Record since I have no budget or skills to properly brand this project (yet): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voyager_Golden_Record

The idea for the project was to white-label it so anyone can integrate it into their apps/workflow, so making it easy for them to co-brand would be cool...Would love your thoughts on this!

title: Make it more obvious this is sending media to the IA
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It would be great if it were more apparent that users are sending their media to the IA. Ideas:
1. perhaps add something like "In Collaboration with the Internet Archive" or possible just uniting Tor + CC + IA somewhere on the homescreen? 
2. When clicking "upload media" instead have it say "send/save to/at internet archive" 
3. When media is uploading, indstead of "please wait" perhaps put "sending to Internet Archive" 

All ideas welcome!

title: Getting this project going again...
body:
Due to interest in support Internet Archive uploading in our CameraV/InformaCam app, and general excitement about an easy archive.org uploader app, I have begun working to get the remaining issues sorted out.

The app is now functioning again, and the underlying code and library dependencies are greatly simplified. 

From here, I will be exploring some UI updates as well as integration via Intents with our CameraV export functions.
